etymologies: mid 19th century: modern Latin, from Greek ekhidna ‘viper’, also the name of a mythical creature which gave birth to the Hydra; compare with ekhinos ‘sea urchin, hedgehog’

definitions: a spiny insectivorous egg-laying mammal with a long snout and claws, native to Australia and New Guinea.

notes.text: Family Tachyglossidae, order Monotremata: two genera and species, in particular Tachyglossus aculeatus

shortDefinitions: spiny insectivorous egg-laying mammal with long snout and claws, native to Australia and New Guinea
